sub_title: Chairman of the Forum on Economic and Fiscal Policy
summary:
Dr. Ramon S.J. Dwarkasing is Chairman of the Forum on Economic and Fiscal Policy.
The Forum on Economic and Fiscal Policy (www.fefp.org) is a non-profit,  independent international think tank based in The Hague, Netherlands - Europe.  The FEFP's mission is to conduct high-quality, independent research and, based on that research, to provide innovative, practical recommendations that advance its main broad goal: to improve the quality of global economic and fiscal policy with open and fact-based research, analysis and debate from a multi-stakeholder perspective.
The Forum on Economic and Fiscal Policy (the FEFP) is a non-profit, non-doctrinal, and not tied to any special interests, independent organization. The Forum convenes the most relevant actors from all sectors -business, government, academia and civil society- in a high-level, informal environment of dialogue and science.

Dr. Ramon S.J. Dwarkasing is the founder and managing partner of Dwarkasing & Partners, an independent research-based consultancy firm that helps enterprises, public-sector bodies and social-sector organizations worldwide to improve their performance and tackle their most serious challenges in transfer pricing, corporate finance, economics, fiscal policy and taxation.

He holds a PhD in tax law and transfer pricing from Tilburg University, the Netherlands and an LL.M. in international tax law from the International Tax Center Leiden and a master of tax law from Tilburg University. He was affiliated to Maastricht University, specialization Transfer Pricing. Dr. Dwarkasing is author of the book "Associated Enterprises - A Concept Essential for the Application of the Arm's Length Principle and Transfer Pricing", which can be considered as of the first global comprehensive studies on the concept of association, the fundament of transfer pricing.

profile_positions.description:
Dr. Ramon S.J. Dwarkasing LL.M. is the founder and managing partner of Dwarkasing & Partners, an independent research-based consultancy firm that helps enterprises, public-sector bodies and social-sector organizations worldwide to improve their performance and tackle their most serious challenges in corporate finance, economics, fiscal policy and taxation.

Dr. Dwarkasing was an Associate Professor of Transfer Pricing at Maastricht University, the Netherlands (Europe). He holds a PhD in tax law and transfer pricing from Tilburg University, the Netherlands and an LL.M. in international tax law from the International Tax Center Leiden and a master of tax law from Tilburg University. Dr. Dwarkasing is author of the book "Associated Enterprises - A Concept Essential for the Application of the Arm's Length Principle and Transfer Pricing", which can be considered as of the first global comprehensive studies on the concept of association, the fundament of transfer pricing. He is author of various articles in the field of international taxation.

Dr. Dwarkasing is a frequent speaker on international conferences.He is an academic researcher on international taxation and transfer pricing, with a particular focus on tax policy and transfer pricing for least developed and developing economies, and economies in transition.

He is a special independent advisor on transfer pricing and fiscal issues and training for governments of developing and emerging countries, non-governmental organisations and MNEs.
Dr. Dwarkasing assists also various tax law firms and tax authorities in Europe, Asia, Africa and South America in specific tax cases.
